file_insights.significance: Added new external dependency for Amazon Selling Partner API integration

patterns_discovered.description: Project maintains a requirements.txt file for Python package management with semantic versioning constraints
Requirements file is kept lean with only essential packages: anthropic, python-dotenv, and amazon-sp-api
Uses minimum version constraints (>=) rather than fixed versions, allowing patch updates while maintaining compatibility

gotchas_discovered.description: Task completed on first attempt without iteration, indicating either straightforward nature of dependency addition or pre-validation of library compatibility
Session shows requirements.txt only - no indication of requirements-lock.txt or Pipfile.lock, which could lead to dependency version drift in production

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully added Amazon SP-API Python library (python-amazon-sp-api>=1.0.0) to project dependencies

recommendations.recommendation: Consider implementing a requirements-lock.txt or poetry.lock file to ensure reproducible builds across environments
Add comments to requirements.txt indicating why each dependency is needed (e.g., '# Anthropic AI API client' for anthropic package)
Verify Amazon SP-API library compatibility with existing anthropic>=0.39.0 and python-dotenv>=1.0.0 versions through integration testing
Monitor python-amazon-sp-api releases for security updates and breaking changes, consider periodic dependency audits
